meanings.definition: To begin or set in motion.
meanings.sent1: She is initiating the project by creating a detailed plan.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is initiating the class discussion on a new topic.
meanings.sent3: Initiating the game of tag, the children raced around the playground.
meanings.sent4: By initiating the conversation, he opened up a new opportunity for collaboration.
meanings.sent5: Initiating the engine, the car roared to life with a loud rumble.

meanings.sent1: The company is initiating a new marketing campaign to attract customers.
meanings.sent2: She is initiating a new tradition in her family by baking cookies every Sunday.
meanings.sent3: Initiating the joke, he made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: By initiating the policy change, the manager improved efficiency in the workplace.
meanings.sent5: Initiating the game, the referee blew the whistle to start the match.

meanings.definition: To take the first step in a process.
meanings.sent1: He is initiating the negotiation by proposing a fair deal.
meanings.sent2: The student is initiating the research process by gathering relevant information.
meanings.sent3: Initiating the adventure, they set off on a thrilling journey.
meanings.sent4: By initiating the project, she paved the way for future success.
meanings.sent5: Initiating the exploration, the team ventured into the unknown with excitement.
